title.#cdata-section: CBC | World News

description.#cdata-section: FOR PERSONAL USE ONLY

title.#cdata-section: CBC | World News
Trudeau struggling to walk a very fine line on Israel-Hamas war
Canada's voting record at United Nations faces scrutiny as Israel-Hamas war intensifies

description.#cdata-section: Amid Israel's war with Hamas and the heated debates that have arisen at the United Nations as a result, Canada's public positions on the Middle East are being examined and scrutinized more than ever before.

title.#cdata-section: SpaceX Starship test flight fails minutes after launch

description.#cdata-section: SpaceX's uncrewed spacecraft Starship, developed to carry astronauts to the moon and beyond, was presumed to have failed in space minutes after lifting off on Saturday in a second test after its first attempt to reach space ended in an explosion.

title.#cdata-section: TikTok prohibits videos promoting bin Laden's 'Letter to America'

description.#cdata-section: TikTok will prohibit content that promotes Osama bin Laden's 2002 letter detailing the former al-Qaeda leader's justifications for attacks against Americans, the app said on Thursday.

title.#cdata-section: As major Pacific summit wraps, Canada is sidelined on a new U.S.-led trade initiative

description.#cdata-section: Canada left a major summit centred on Pacific economic development on the outside of a new U.S. initiative, the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework, a group of 14 trading partners that concluded agreements this week on supply chain protections, lowering carbon emissions and fighting corruption.

title.#cdata-section: One friendly meeting: What's changed, what hasn't in China-U.S. rivalry

description.#cdata-section: In effort to save a crumbling relationship between global giants, the leaders of China and the U.S. on Wednesday met for the first time in a year. It went well. Here's what’s changed in the most important relationship on Earth — and what hasn't.

title.#cdata-section: Starbucks workers across U.S. walk off the job Thursday to protest work conditions

description.#cdata-section: Workers at hundreds of Starbucks stores began walking off the job during a key promotional event on Thursday, demanding improved staffing and schedules, the Workers United said on social media platform X.

title.#cdata-section: Canadian David DePape convicted of attempted kidnapping, assault of Paul Pelosi

description.#cdata-section: A jury on Thursday convicted the Canadian man who broke into former U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's San Francisco home last year, seeking to hold her hostage, and attacked her husband with a hammer. He was convicted of federal charges of attempted kidnapping and assault.

title.#cdata-section: 'Staggering' rise in global measles cases last year, say leading health organizations

description.#cdata-section: Global measles cases jumped by 18 per cent in a year to an estimated nine million, and deaths rose to 136,000 — mostly among children — the World Health Organization and the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said in a joint statement on Thursday.

title.#cdata-section: Pushing the bounds of human limits on Guinness World Records Day 2023

description.#cdata-section: Guinness World Records editor-in-chief Craig Glenday calls Nov. 16 a 'global celebration of the superlative,' highlighting the many world records attempted and broken in dazzling displays of technical skills and physical abilities.

title.#cdata-section: Supreme Court won't hear case of four Canadian men detained in Syria

description.#cdata-section: The country's top court will not hear the case of four Canadian men held in Syria who argue Ottawa has a legal duty to help them return home.

title.#cdata-section: World-first gene therapy for 2 blood disorders — sickle cell and thalassemia — approved

description.#cdata-section: Britain's medical regulator has announced it's authorized a gene therapy for sickle cell disease and another type of inherited blood disorder for patients aged 12 and over.

title.#cdata-section: Scathing ethics report concludes embattled U.S. lawmaker George Santos 'cannot be trusted'

description.#cdata-section: The U.S. House ethics committee in a scathing report says it has amassed "overwhelming evidence" of lawbreaking by Rep. George Santos of New York that has been sent to the U.S. Justice Department, concluding flatly that the Republican "cannot be trusted" after a months-long investigation into his conduct.

title.#cdata-section: More pandas will be headed to the U.S., China's Xi suggests

description.#cdata-section: Chinese President Xi Jinping signalled Wednesday that China will send new pandas to the United States, calling them "envoys of friendship between the Chinese and American peoples."

title.#cdata-section: Syria ordered by World Court to halt torture and preserve evidence

description.#cdata-section: Judges at the World Court on Thursday ordered Syria to take steps to prevent torture as part of emergency measures in a case against Damascus brought before the top United Natons tribunal by the Netherlands and Canada.

title.#cdata-section: Cyprus lit up with flurry of oligarch transactions after Russia invaded Ukraine, leaked files show

description.#cdata-section: Newly revealed leaked documents show how oligarchs feverishly tried to move money and assets based in Cyprus in the weeks after Russia invaded Ukraine in early 2022, as European Union and other sanctions loomed.

item.cbc:authorName: Zach Dubinsky and the International Consortium of Investigative Journalists

title.#cdata-section: Thousands of vulnerable turtles released back into the wild as part of repopulation effort

description.#cdata-section: A gentle wave of freshly released yellow-spotted turtles surged back into a river in Peru's Amazon region with adults and children looking on, and in some cases helping herd stragglers back on course. This was part of a project between the public and private sectors within the Maynas province of Peru to help repopulate the river and preserve the tiny turtles, whose species has been categorized as vulnerable.

title.#cdata-section: Scientists warn of 'dangerous future' if global emissions aren't cut

description.#cdata-section: Climate change is increasingly impacting the health and survival of people worldwide, and projections show risks will quickly rise with further inaction, scientists warn in a new report.

title.#cdata-section: Ex-mother-in-law arrested in killing of Daniel Markel, law professor from Toronto

description.#cdata-section: The matriarch of a South Florida family was arrested at Miami International Airport on charges of orchestrating the hit-man murder in Florida of her ex-son-in-law, Daniel Markel from Toronto.

title.#cdata-section: British plan to send some migrants to Rwanda struck down by its top court

description.#cdata-section: Britain's Supreme Court ruled Wednesday that the government's contentious plan to send some migrants on a one-way trip to Rwanda is illegal, striking a major blow to a key policy of Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's government that has drawn international attention and criticism.
